column4: greets. A question. I've to install ubuntu feisty on a new thinkpad t61p which is a Core 2 Duo based machine. Does anyone here know if this needs an x86 or x86-64 install CD ?
if you have to ask (inexperience), install 32-bit
pdxchar, thanks! I read on the relevant wikipedia page that a Core 2 Duo is a 64-bit Core. Doesn't that mean that it needs a 64-bit x86 distr ?
no, it doesnt need. you can run both. ut 64-bit still has some problems with especially proprietary software and solving them requries experience and time
